page.title: 18The Changing Scene
page.content: The centre of Sudbury has remained virtually unchanged for most of this century although a one-way traffic system introduced in the late 1960's made the Market Hill quieter and less prone to traffic congestion. Sudbury is an old town which does not cope easily with the demands of modern living and two new developments designed to make life more pleasant have created controversy. THE SUDBURY EASTERN BY-PASS- This new road was begun in early 1985 to relieve the town of heavy through traffic. The road will join the A143 at the north west of the town to the A134 Colchester road. The by-pass will increase traffic on Springlands residential estate and will destroy some pleasant views. THE INDOOR SWIMMING POOL-This is a much needed facility but is adjacent to the pleasant and peaceful water-meadows.
